mainBoard.name: Death Baron
mainBoard.originalText: Skeletons you control and other Zombies you control get +1/+1 and have deathtouch.

rulings.text: A creature that’s both a Skeleton and a Zombie will get the bonus only once.
Death Baron doesn’t normally affect itself. If you manage to turn it into a Skeleton, however, then it will give itself +1/+1 and deathtouch.

Because damage remains marked on a creature until it’s removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to a Skeleton or Zombie you control may become lethal if Death Baron leaves the battlefield during that turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
mainBoard.name: Fleshbag Marauder
mainBoard.originalText: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder itself. If you control no other creatures, you’ll have to sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder.

As Fleshbag Marauder’s ability resolves, first you choose a creature to sacrifice, then each other player in turn order chooses a creature to sacrifice, then all those creatures are sacrificed simultaneously.

mainBoard.text: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

mainBoard.name: Tattered Mummy
mainBoard.originalText: When Tattered Mummy dies, each opponent loses 2 life.

rulings.text: If your life total is brought to 0 or less at the same time that Tattered Mummy is dealt lethal damage, you lose the game before its triggered ability goes on the stack.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, the triggered ability of Tattered Mummy causes the opposing team to lose 4 life.

mainBoard.name: Blood Divination
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast Blood Divination; you can’t cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you can’t sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can respond only after Blood Divination has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

mainBoard.name: Bone Splinters
mainBoard.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy target creature.

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you can’t cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you can’t sacrifice additional creatures.
Once you begin to cast Bone Splinters, no player may take actions until you’re done. Notably, opponents can’t try to remove the creature you wish to sacrifice.
